intro: Primula farinosa var. caucasica, commonly known as the Caucasian primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and clusters of pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It has a short growing season and is often found at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Primulaceae family.
